Package com.example.eventlottery

Class UserPanelTest

java.lang.Object
com.example.eventlottery.UserPanelTest
public class UserPanelTest extends Object
Unit tests for UserPanel Tests business logic that can be extracted and tested independently

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    setUp()
    Sets up test fixtures before each test method Creates a test user and multiple test events with proper dates
    void
    testEventListNotEmpty()
    Tests that the test events list is properly initialized Verifies setUp() method creates the expected number of events
    void
    testFindEventById_EmptyList()
    Tests that findEventById returns null when given an empty event list Verifies proper handling of edge case with no events
    void
    testFindEventById_EventDoesNotExist()
    Tests that findEventById returns null when searching for a non-existent event Ensures the method handles missing events gracefully
    void
    testFindEventById_EventExists()
    Tests that findEventById correctly finds an event that exists in the list Verifies both the event is found and that it's the correct event
    void
    testFindEventById_MultipleEvents()
    Tests that findEventById works correctly with a larger list of events Verifies the search algorithm scales properly with more events
    void
    testFindEventById_NullId()
    Tests that findEventById handles null event ID parameter safely Ensures the method doesn't throw exceptions with invalid input
    void
    testFormatEventDateTime_CurrentDate()
    Tests that formatEventDateTime correctly formats the current date and time Ensures the formatter works with real-time data
    void
    testFormatEventDateTime_MidnightTime()
    Tests that formatEventDateTime handles midnight (00:00) time correctly Verifies proper formatting of edge case time values
    void
    testFormatEventDateTime_ValidDate()
    Tests that formatEventDateTime produces a valid formatted string for a specific date Verifies the format includes month, day, year, and time components
    void
    testMultipleEventStatuses()
    Tests that different event statuses are properly distinguished Verifies all status types (Accepted, Notified, Waitlisted, Declined) work correctly
    void
    testMultipleWaitlistedEvents()
    Tests that multiple events can be added to waitlist Verifies the waitlist collection properly stores multiple event IDs
    void
    testRegisteredEventStatus()
    Tests that registered events maintain their status correctly Verifies the status string is stored and retrieved properly
    void
    testSetRegisteredEvents()
    Tests that setRegisteredEvents correctly replaces the entire registered events map Verifies the method used when loading data from Firestore
    void
    testSetWaitlistedEventIds()
    Tests that setWaitlistedEventIds correctly replaces the entire waitlist Verifies the method used when loading data from Firestore
    void
    testUserHasEvents()
    Tests that a user correctly stores registered and waitlisted events Verifies the user object can maintain event state
    void
    testUserHasNoEvents_Initially()
    Tests that a newly created user has no events initially Verifies default state of user's registered and waitlisted event lists
